tp.pr4.logic

Class Move

  • java.lang.Object
    • tp.pr4.logic.Move
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ComplicaMove, Connect4Move, GravityMove

    public abstract class Move
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that represents a move made by a player of the game. It has a method to execute the move on a given board and another to undo the move on a given board. It is an abstract class; there will be a derived concrete class for each type of game supported.
    Since:
    Assignment 2

      • getPlayer

        public Counter getPlayer()
        Returns the colour of the player who makes this move (may, or may not, be abstract)
        Returns:
        Colour of the counter placed in the course of this move (coincides with that passed to the constructor).

      • executeMove

        public abstract void executeMove(Board board)
                          throws InvalidMove
        Executes the move on the board passed as a parameter. It is assumed that the board passed as a parameter is consistent with the rules of the game for which the move was created. If not, the behaviour is undefined.
        Parameters:
        board - Board on which to execute the move.
        Throws:
        InvalidMove

      • undo

        public abstract void undo(Board board)
        Undoes the move on the board passed as a parameter. It is assumed that the board passed as a parameter is consistent with the rules of the game for which the move was created and that, furthermore, the move to be undone was indeed the last one executed on that board. If not, the behaviour is undefined. The method can therefore be expected to always work correctly.
        Parameters:
        board - Board on which to undo the move.
